block.p: Victoria Sue Stamm and David Bodne Colby were married in Philadelphia yesterday evening by Rabbi Henry Cohen in the reception room of City Hall.

Mrs. Colby, 37, is the vice president and creative director of Platinum Design, a graphic design company in New York. She graduated from the Parsons School of Design in New York. Her parents, Elayne and Stephen Stamm, live in Merion, Pa. Her father retired as an aerospace project manager in King of Prussia, Pa., for the General Electric Company. He later taught physics at the Agnes Irwin School, a private school for girls in Rosemont, Pa.
Victoria Sue Stamm and David Bodne Colby were married in Philadelphia yesterday evening by Rabbi Henry Cohen in the reception room of City Hall.

Mrs. Colby, 37, is the vice president and creative director of Platinum Design, a graphic design company in New York. She graduated from the Parsons School of Design in New York. Her parents, Elayne and Stephen Stamm, live in Merion, Pa. Her father retired as an aerospace project manager in King of Prussia, Pa., for the General Electric Company. He later taught physics at the Agnes Irwin School, a private school for girls in Rosemont, Pa.
Her mother, who retired as a reading specialist at the William Levering School in Philadelphia, is a travel agent for the Circle Travel Service in Narberth, Pa.

Mr. Colby, 38, is the senior writer for the Manhattan Newspaper Group, a community newspaper organization. He graduated from New York University. He is a son of Renee Colby Chubet of New York and the late Sidney J. Colby, who was manager of the Algonquin Hotel in New York, which was owned by the bridegroom's maternal grandparents, Ben and Mary Bodne.
